segment.source: HttpClient
segment.target: HttpClient

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: Use **HttpClient** and the rest of the **Windows.Web.Http** namespace API to send and receive information using the HTTP 2.0 and HTTP 1.1 protocols.
segment.target: Use **HttpClient** and the rest of the **Windows.Web.Http** namespace API to send and receive information using the HTTP 2.0 and HTTP 1.1 protocols.

segment.source: Overview of HttpClient and the Windows.Web.Http namespace
segment.target: Overview of HttpClient and the Windows.Web.Http namespace

segment.source: The classes in the **Windows.Web.Http** namespace and the related **Windows.Web.Http.Headers** and **Windows.Web.Http.Filters** namespaces provide a programming interface for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps that act as an HTTP client to perform basic GET requests or implement more advanced HTTP functionality listed below.
segment.target: The classes in the **Windows.Web.Http** namespace and the related **Windows.Web.Http.Headers** and **Windows.Web.Http.Filters** namespaces provide a programming interface for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps that act as an HTTP client to perform basic GET requests or implement more advanced HTTP functionality listed below.

segment.source: Methods for common verbs (DELETE, GET, PUT, and POST).
segment.target: Methods for common verbs (DELETE, GET, PUT, and POST).

segment.source: Each of these requests are sent as an asynchronous operation.
segment.target: Each of these requests are sent as an asynchronous operation.

segment.source: Support for common authentication settings and patterns.
segment.target: Support for common authentication settings and patterns.

segment.source: Access to Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) details on the transport.
segment.target: Access to Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) details on the transport.

segment.source: Ability to include customized filters in advanced apps.
segment.target: Ability to include customized filters in advanced apps.

segment.source: Ability to get, set, and delete cookies.
segment.target: Ability to get, set, and delete cookies.

segment.source: HTTP Request progress info available on asynchronous methods.
segment.target: HTTP Request progress info available on asynchronous methods.

segment.source: The **Windows.Web.Http.HttpRequestMessage** class represents an HTTP request message sent by **Windows.Web.Http.HttpClient**.
segment.target: The **Windows.Web.Http.HttpRequestMessage** class represents an HTTP request message sent by **Windows.Web.Http.HttpClient**.

segment.source: The **Windows.Web.Http.HttpResponseMessage** class represents an HTTP response message received from an HTTP request.
segment.target: The **Windows.Web.Http.HttpResponseMessage** class represents an HTTP response message received from an HTTP request.

segment.source: HTTP messages are defined in RFC 2616 by the IETF.
segment.target: HTTP messages are defined in RFC 2616 by the IETF.

segment.source: The **Windows.Web.Http** namespace represents HTTP content as the HTTP entity body and headers including cookies.
segment.target: The **Windows.Web.Http** namespace represents HTTP content as the HTTP entity body and headers including cookies.

segment.source: HTTP content can be associated with an HTTP request or an HTTP response.
segment.target: HTTP content can be associated with an HTTP request or an HTTP response.

segment.source: The Windows.Web.Http namespace provides a number of different classes to represent HTTP content.
segment.target: The Windows.Web.Http namespace provides a number of different classes to represent HTTP content.

segment.source:
**HttpBufferContent**
.
segment.target:
**HttpBufferContent**
.

segment.source: Content as a buffer
segment.target: Content as a buffer

segment.source:
**HttpFormUrlEncodedContent**
.
segment.target:
**HttpFormUrlEncodedContent**
.

segment.source: Content as name and value tuples encoded with the application/x-www-form-urlencoded MIME type
segment.target: Content as name and value tuples encoded with the application/x-www-form-urlencoded MIME type

segment.source:
**HttpMultipartContent**
.
segment.target:
**HttpMultipartContent**
.

segment.source: Content in the form of the multipart/\* MIME type.
segment.target: Content in the form of the multipart/\* MIME type.

segment.source:
**HttpMultipartFormDataContent**
.
segment.target:
**HttpMultipartFormDataContent**
.

segment.source: Content that is encoded as the multipart/form-data MIME type.
segment.target: Content that is encoded as the multipart/form-data MIME type.

segment.source:
**HttpStreamContent**
.
segment.target:
**HttpStreamContent**
.

segment.source: Content as a stream (the internal type is used by the HTTP GET method to receive data and the HTTP POST method to upload data)
segment.target: Content as a stream (the internal type is used by the HTTP GET method to receive data and the HTTP POST method to upload data)

segment.source:
**HttpStringContent**
.
segment.target:
**HttpStringContent**
.

segment.source: Content as a string.
segment.target: Content as a string.

segment.source:
**IHttpContent**
- A base interface for developers to create their own content objects
segment.target:
**IHttpContent**
- A base interface for developers to create their own content objects

segment.source: The code snippet in the "Send a simple GET request over HTTP" section uses the **HttpStringContent** class to represent the HTTP response from an HTTP GET request as a string.
segment.target: The code snippet in the "Send a simple GET request over HTTP" section uses the **HttpStringContent** class to represent the HTTP response from an HTTP GET request as a string.

segment.source: The **Windows.Web.Http.Headers** namespace supports creation of HTTP headers and cookies, which are then associated as properties with **HttpRequestMessage** and **HttpResponseMessage** objects.
segment.target: The **Windows.Web.Http.Headers** namespace supports creation of HTTP headers and cookies, which are then associated as properties with **HttpRequestMessage** and **HttpResponseMessage** objects.

segment.source: Send a simple GET request over HTTP
segment.target: Send a simple GET request over HTTP

segment.source: As mentioned earlier in this article, the **Windows.Web.Http** namespace allows UWP apps to send GET requests.
segment.target: As mentioned earlier in this article, the **Windows.Web.Http** namespace allows UWP apps to send GET requests.

segment.source: The following code snippet demonstrates how to send a GET request to http://www.contoso.com using the **Windows.Web.Http.HttpClient** class and the **Windows.Web.Http.HttpResponseMessage** class to read the response from the GET request.
segment.target: The following code snippet demonstrates how to send a GET request to http://www.contoso.com using the **Windows.Web.Http.HttpClient** class and the **Windows.Web.Http.HttpResponseMessage** class to read the response from the GET request.

segment.source: Exceptions in Windows.Web.Http
segment.target: Exceptions in Windows.Web.Http

segment.source: An exception is thrown when an invalid string for a the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) is passed to the constructor for the **Windows.Foundation.Uri** object.
segment.target: An exception is thrown when an invalid string for a the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) is passed to the constructor for the **Windows.Foundation.Uri** object.

segment.source: *.NET: *The **Windows.Foundation.Uri** type appears as **System.Uri** in C\# and VB.
segment.target: *.NET: *The **Windows.Foundation.Uri** type appears as **System.Uri** in C\# and VB.

segment.source: In C\# and Visual Basic, this error can be avoided by using the **System.Uri** class in the .NET 4.5 and one of the **System.Uri.TryCreate** methods to test the string received from a user before the URI is constructed.
segment.target: In C\# and Visual Basic, this error can be avoided by using the **System.Uri** class in the .NET 4.5 and one of the **System.Uri.TryCreate** methods to test the string received from a user before the URI is constructed.

segment.source: In C++, there is no method to try and parse a string to a URI.
segment.target: In C++, there is no method to try and parse a string to a URI.

segment.source: If an app gets input from the user for the **Windows.Foundation.Uri**, the constructor should be in a try/catch block.
segment.target: If an app gets input from the user for the **Windows.Foundation.Uri**, the constructor should be in a try/catch block.

segment.source: If an exception is thrown, the app can notify the user and request a new hostname.
segment.target: If an exception is thrown, the app can notify the user and request a new hostname.

segment.source: The **Windows.Web.Http** lacks a convenience function.
segment.target: The **Windows.Web.Http** lacks a convenience function.

segment.source: So an app using **HttpClient** and other classes in this namespace needs to use the HRESULT value.
segment.target: So an app using **HttpClient** and other classes in this namespace needs to use the HRESULT value.

segment.source: In apps using the .NET Framework 4.5 in C\#, VB.NET, the System.Exception represents an error during app execution when an exception occurs.
segment.target: In apps using the .NET Framework 4.5 in C\#, VB.NET, the System.Exception represents an error during app execution when an exception occurs.

segment.source: The System.Exception.HResult property returns the HRESULT assigned to the specific exception.
segment.target: The System.Exception.HResult property returns the HRESULT assigned to the specific exception.

segment.source: The System.Exception.Message property returns the message that describes the exception.
segment.target: The System.Exception.Message property returns the message that describes the exception.

segment.source: Possible HRESULT values are listed in the Winerror.h header file.
segment.target: Possible HRESULT values are listed in the Winerror.h header file.

segment.source: An app can filter on specific HRESULT values to modify app behavior depending on the cause of the exception.
segment.target: An app can filter on specific HRESULT values to modify app behavior depending on the cause of the exception.

segment.source: In apps using managed C++, the Platform::Exception represents an error during app execution when an exception occurs.
segment.target: In apps using managed C++, the Platform::Exception represents an error during app execution when an exception occurs.

segment.source: The Platform::Exception::HResult property returns the HRESULT assigned to the specific exception.
segment.target: The Platform::Exception::HResult property returns the HRESULT assigned to the specific exception.

segment.source: The Platform::Exception::Message property returns the system-provided string that is associated with the HRESULT value.
segment.target: The Platform::Exception::Message property returns the system-provided string that is associated with the HRESULT value.

segment.source: Possible HRESULT values are listed in the Winerror.h header file.
segment.target: Possible HRESULT values are listed in the Winerror.h header file.

segment.source: An app can filter on specific HRESULT values to modify app behavior depending on the cause of the exception.
segment.target: An app can filter on specific HRESULT values to modify app behavior depending on the cause of the exception.

segment.source: For most parameter validation errors, the HRESULT returned is E\_INVALIDARG.
segment.target: For most parameter validation errors, the HRESULT returned is E\_INVALIDARG.

segment.source: For some illegal method calls, the HRESULT returned is E\_ILLEGAL\_METHOD\_CALL.
segment.target: For some illegal method calls, the HRESULT returned is E\_ILLEGAL\_METHOD\_CALL.
